text:
It is good practice to manually identify and remove systematic structures from time series
data to make the problem easier to model (e.g. make the series stationary), and this may still
be a best practice when using recurrent neural networks. But, the general capability of these
networks suggests that this may not be a requirement for a skillful model. Technically, the
available context of the sequence provided as input may allow neural network models to learn
